articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A missile launched from Yemen towards Israel on Sunday landed near Ben Gurion Airport, the country's main international airport, where footage shared on social media showed a plume of smoke visible from a passenger terminal.
articles.title: Missile launched from Yemen lands near Israel's main airport

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Elizaveta Gladun
articles.description: Political analysts said a victory for hard-right eurosceptic George Simion could isolate the country, erode private investment and destabilize NATO's eastern flank, where Ukraine is fighting Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Romanian nationalist Simion on course for election win, exit polls show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Defence Minister Aziz Nasirzadeh said on Sunday that Tehran would strike back if the United States or Israel attacked.
articles.title: Iran says it will strike back if US or Israel attack

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: The New Zealand government said on Sunday it had set aside NZ$2 billion ($1.19 billion) in its upcoming budget to replace the Defence Force’s aging maritime helicopters, as global tensions increase.
articles.title: New Zealand to spend NZ$2 billion on new maritime helicopters

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: The military has begun issuing tens of thousands of call-up orders for its reserve forces, looking to expand the Gaza campaign, its chief said.
articles.title: Netanyahu to convene ministers on new phase of Gaza war and aid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov spoke to his Pakistani counterpart on Sunday and offered Russia's help in resolving tensions between Pakistan and India over Kashmir, the Foreign Ministry said.
articles.title: Russia says willing to help resolve India-Pakistan differences over Kashmir

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One of Pope Francis's popemobiles is being transformed into a mobile health clinic for children in the Gaza Strip, fulfilling one of his final wishes, the Vatican's official media outlet said on Sunday.
articles.title: Pope Francis's popemobile set to become health clinic for Gaza children

articles.author: Gergely Szakacs
articles.description: The Hungarian government's budget plans for the 2026 election year could be at risk if its economic growth assumptions prove too optimistic, the head of budget watchdog Fiscal Council told Reuters.
articles.title: Hungary's election-year 2026 budget hinges on risky growth projection, fiscal watchdog says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Incoming German interior minister Alexander Dobrindt suggested on Sunday it was unlikely the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party would be banned after the spy agency classified it as "extremist" last week.
articles.title: Incoming German interior minister sceptical about ban on far-right AfD

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy, speaking at a news conference in Prague alongside Czech President Petr Pavel, said that unless increased pressure were applied, Vladimir Putin would take no real steps to end the conflict.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy, in Prague, says ceasefire could be put in place at any moment
